summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Mystery of Edwin Drood
Review Date: 2015/04/07
Categories: Drama
Product Description: ['Acclaimed screenwriter Gwyneth Hughes brings to life this unfinished tale of obsessive love and betrayal, the last story Charles Dickens would ever write before his death.']
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Diarmuid Lawrence'], 'Producers': ['BBC'], 'Starring': ['Matthew Rhys ("Brothers & Sisters")', 'Julia MacKenzie ("Miss Marple")']}
Review Text: Great drama!  Don't miss this.
Review Title: WOW!  Great drama.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/04/16
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
Review Text: LOVE this and so does my 85-year-old-mother.  Right now, she is ill and this series makes her laugh and take her mind off her pains.  I know the writers have already thought of this, but I can't wait for the episode when Howard OR Chuck needs James's help so we can see what kind of a person James really is.  Let him show up the other two jerks.  TWO THUMBS UP.  Thanks for not dragging a romance into what should be kept an interesting comedy.  Kim is lovely, but I hope that part stays platonic.  GOOD LUCK WITH SEASON 2.
Review Title: Gives my ailing mother a reprieve from her illness.  We both LOVE JIMMY
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/05/04
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Thomas Schnauz', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
Review Text: This is the ONLY THING WORTH WATCHING on TV and has been the only thing for both seasons.  Unfortunately, I now must wait for season 3.  I'll have to go through the next 10 months without it.  KEEP up the good work, Jonathan, Bob, and Rhee.  I also like the other characters, the acting is very good, but I don't like the kind of characters they represent.  Howard is a p---k.  So is Chuck.  Both are great actors.
Review Title: KEEP up the good work, Jonathan
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2017/05/31
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vince Gilligan', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Peter Gould', 'Michael Morris', 'Adam Bernstein', 'Michelle MacLaren', 'Colin Bucksey', 'John Shiban', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Terry McDonough'], 'Producers': ['Gennifer Hutchison', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould']}
Review Text: As everyone knows, this show is ADDICTIVE and once you watch it, there's no going back.  Even my 87-year-old mother watches it and tries to out-guess what is going to happen.  One question I would have:  Why didn't Kim hire Jimmy to be her paralegal?  In that role, he wouldn't be practicing.  But, it would destroy his attempt to get rid of his air time on TV.  GREAT JOB by all actors.  The writers are to be commended also.  We love those characters we are supposed to love and hate the ones we are supposed to (namely Hector, Chuck and Howard.)  But they still do a great job of acting.  In Episode 9, you almost (ALMOST) have to feel sorry for Chuck.  As brilliant an attorney as he is, he is turning into a truly pathetic creature, which is strange, now that he has licked his anti-electricity problem.
Review Title: WARNING !!!  ADDICTIVE !!!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/03/06
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'Mark Gordon', 'Simon Kinberg', 'Kenneth Branagh', 'Judy Hofflund', 'Michael Schaefer'], 'Starring': ['Kenneth Branagh', 'Penélope Cruz', 'Johnny Depp'], 'Studio': ['Kinberg Genre;The Mark Gordon Company;Scott Free']}
Review Text: Compared to the 1974 version, the actors and their dialogues seemed somewhat anemic.  The 1974 version had meatier depths of character for all the travelers.  The photography was beautiful.  I found it more comical than a drama, mostly because of Branagh's overly long mustache.  Hard to make Poirot believable.  He is usually a fine actor and is taken seriously as an actor.  What was he thinking?  It was a humorous distraction.
Review Title: The photography was beautiful. I found it more comical than a drama
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/04/22
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gus Van Sant', 'Ryan Murphy', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Helen Hunt', 'Liza Johnson', 'Tim Minear'], 'Producers': ['Eric Kovtun', 'Tanase Popa', 'Dede Gardner', 'Jessica Lange'], 'Studio': ['FX']}
Review Text: This was very entertaining, but in real life, I sincerely doubt Bette Davis ever considered Joan Crawford as a real rival.  Her many nominations by The Academy speak for itself.
Review Title: This was very entertaining, but in real life, ...
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/07/05
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jim Sheridan'], 'Producers': ['Noel Pearson', 'Rob Quigley'], 'Starring': ['Rooney Mara', 'Vanessa Redgrave', 'Eric Bana'], 'Studio': ['Vertical Entertainment']}
Review Text: Poignant, deep character development, played superbly by Redgrave (masterful performance) along with Rooney Mara (the young and long-suffering, misaligned woman who, through no fault of her own, was persecuted by not only the church, but the small-minds of her village.  As a result, she was made to waste her life in a madhouse, with the staff believing she had killed her baby.  After 50 years, the tale is finally revealed in a truth that could have given her a joyful life...but didn't until the very end.
Review Title: Wonderful plot, portrayed by acting in which each character had a deeply developed character and personality.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/07/09
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kenneth Branagh'], 'Producers': ['Ridley Scott', 'Mark Gordon', 'Simon Kinberg', 'Kenneth Branagh', 'Judy Hofflund', 'Michael Schaefer'], 'Starring': ['Kenneth Branagh', 'Penélope Cruz', 'Johnny Depp'], 'Studio': ['Kinberg Genre;The Mark Gordon Company;Scott Free']}
Review Text: What can I say.  When compared to the Albert Finney version a few decades ago, this one doesn't leave the starting gate.  For starters, the Finney version built a depth of atmosphere within the first five minutes.  When Branagh appears, and although he is a fine actor, I had to laugh at his handlebar mustache, it was that comical.  None of the other actors in this version have the verve of the first one.  Sorry I paid to buy this to keep in my Amazon Video Library, but I was curious -- and sadly disappointed.
Review Title: Don't bother unless you are prepared to be unimpressed.
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2018/08/07
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Gennifer Hutchison', 'Thomas Schnauz', 'Melissa Bernstein', 'Mark Johnson', 'Vince Gilligan', 'Peter Gould'], 'Studio': ['American Movie Classics (AMC)']}
Review Text: I realize the writers have to lay a foundation and that's what they are doing.  The acting has not diminished.  I love all the characters, even Howard, who tends to be a jerk, but you have to have a bad guy, otherwise there is no tension.  I felt sorry for Jimmy when he heard Howard reading all of Chuck's outstanding accomplishments, his schooling, community service, debate team, etc.  I'm sure that made Jimmy feel pretty small in contrast.
Review Title: Season 4, Episode 1 a little slow moving
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/07/24
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Leslie Iwerks'], 'Producers': ['Leslie Iwerks'], 'Starring': ['Kelsey Grammer', 'Roy Disney', 'Chuck Jones'], 'Studio': ['Walt Disney Pictures']}
Review Text: I have read several books and bios about Walt Disney and watched many filmed biographies of him.  While all mention Ub Iwerks, he is usually given only "byline" status.  This is a wonderful biography about a man who was not only an artist, but a remarkable engineer as well.  IF you watch this, keep in mind throughout that Mr. Iwerks was forced to quit school at the age of 14.  Disney, himself a determined genius, must have recognized that Mr. Iwerks was also his intellectual and creative equal and much like him.  I'm glad his granddaughter has given him a place among the Disney family and it is no less than fitting that he deserves to be recognized.
Review Title: Masterful documentary and a must for all Disney fans
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/08/28
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Studio': ['CBS']}
Review Text: Fabulous storylines with great period sets and costumes.  I’m ready to binge.
Review Title: I like it. I want it.  NOW
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/03/22
Average Rating: 3.2
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Lynne Ramsay'], 'Producers': ['Pascal Caucheteux', 'Rosa Attab', 'James Wilson', 'Rebecca O’brien', 'Lynne Ramsay'], 'Starring': ['Joaquin Phoenix', 'Ekaterina Samsonov'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']}
Review Text: It's an OK film, but slow-moving, disjointed and could have used better editing.  A couple of scenes just stupid, like Phoenix laying down next to a guy while he's dying.  Open ended -- girl should have gone been returned to her mother.
Review Title: Slow-moving, disjointed
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

    SUMMARY:
    [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The analyzed purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-quality dramatic narratives across various formats, with consistently high ratings reflecting a deep appreciation for storytelling, particularly in genre-specific dramas and documentaries. Sentiments indicate a strong emotional connection, evidenced by comments about enjoying series with family members, pointing to a social viewing aspect.

Recurring themes highlight an affinity for complex characters and intricate plotlines found in drama and character-driven narratives, with a notable interest in works involving conflict and emotional depth. The individual also shows appreciation for well-crafted cinematography and acting, often citing character portrayals as pivotal to their enjoyment.

Quality preferences lean toward highly rated productions, often avoiding low-rated options unless curiosity drives the purchase. While price sensitivity isn't explicitly stated, a consistent high rating suggests a willingness to invest in premium content, indicating a focus on perceived value over lower-cost alternatives.

Overall, core preferences center around engaging, high-quality dramatic storytelling, rich character development, and strong production values, often enjoyed in a familial setting, highlighting a blend of entertainment and emotional engagement in their viewing choices.

target_interaction.title: What a waste of time.
target_interaction.text: This is a stupid movie with stupid dialog.  I had to turn it off after 15 minutes.  Don't waste your time or money on this one.
